sqlhelper 3.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • How to configure connections

    Reference

    All functions

    close_connections()

    Close all connections and remove them from the connections list

    combine_configs()

    Combine optionally nested yaml config lists

    connections_list()

    Return a list of available connection names

    driver()

    Determine the connection driver

    get_all_configs()

    Return the combined available configurations

    interpolate_sql()

    Parameterize SQL queries

    is.connected()

    Test whether a database is connected

    live_connection()

    Return the named connection or NULL

    not.connected()

    Test whether a database is connected

    nthofk()

    Restrict a query to a sample of 1/nth of the unique values of a key

    read_config_file()

    Return the contents of a config file

    reconnect()

    Re-establish connections to all configured databases

    runfile()

    execute a single file of SQL queries and obtain a flat list of results.

    runfiles()

    Execute a list of .sql files

    runqueries()

    Execute a sequence of SQL queries

    set_connections()

    Populate the list of available connections

    showsql()

    Show to-be-executed SQL code

    sqlhelper

    SQL Helper

    validate_all_configs()

    Apply validate_config to all connection configurations

    validate_config()

    Perform minimal sanity checks on a configuration

    vinnthoffk()

    Restrict a query to values found in a 1/nth sample of the unique values of a foreign key

    yml2conn_str()

    yml2conn_str converts a list object returned by read_yaml() to a db connection string.

    Contents

    Developed by Matthew Roberts.
